name: Communications Workers of America v. Beck
Bankers Life & Casualty Company v. Crenshaw
Laborers Health & Welfare Trust Fund for Northern California v. Advanced Lightweight Concrete Company, Inc.
Edward J. DeBartolo Corporation v. Florida Gulf Coast Building & Construction Trades Council
Pennell v. City of San Jose
question: Did the ordinance violate the Fourteenth Amendment's Due Process Clause?

name: Murray v. United States
question: Does the Fourth Amendment require the suppression of evidence viewed in plain sight prior to an illegal entry that was later discovered in the course of a properly warranted search?
description: A case in which the Court held that evidence that would be excluded under the Fourth Amendment is admissible if it comes from an independent source.

name: Hazelwood School District v. Kuhlmeier
question: Did the principal's deletion of the articles violate the students' rights under the First Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that the principal's right to censor articles from the student-written school newspaper was not an infringement of the students' First Amendment rights.

name: Karcher v. May
question:
Issues:

1. May public officials who have participated in a lawsuit solely in their official capacities appeal an adverse judgment after they have left office?

2. If not, must the appellate court vacate the judgment of the lower court on the grounds that it is unreviewable?

name: Business Electronics Corporation v. Sharp Electronics Corporation
United States v. Providence Journal Company
United Savings Association of Texas v. Timbers of Inwood Forest Associates
United States v. Kozminski
question: Does the protection from involuntary servitude guaranteed by the Thirteenth Amendment extend to the use of psychological coercion?

name: Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. Bollinger
Omni Capital International, Ltd. v. Rudolf Wolff & Company
Boyle v. United Technologies Corporation
question: Are state tort laws, holding independent military contractors liable for injuries caused by their design flaws, valid?

name: Monessen v. Southwestern Railway Company v. Morgan
Braswell v. United States
question: Does the custodian of corporate records have the right to resist a subpoena of those records under his Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination?

name: Honig v. Doe
question:
(1) Is a claim brought under the Education of the Handicapped Act moot if the claimant is over the age of 21?

(2) Does the "stay-put" provision of the Education of the Handicapped Act prevent a school district from indefinitely suspending a student whose handicap-related misconduct endangered the student and others?

name: Wheat v. United States
question: Did the district court violate Wheat’s Sixth Amendment right to his choice of counsel by refusing to permit Wheat’s additional counsel due to a possible conflict of interest?

name: Lyng v. Northwest Indian Cemetery Protective Association
question: Did the First Amendment's Free Exercise Clause prohibit the government from harvesting or developing the Chimney Rock area?

name: Church of Scientology of California v. Internal Revenue Service
Lyng v. International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace & Agricultural Implement Workers of America
FLRA v. Aberdeen Proving Ground, Dept. of Army
Mackey v. Lanier Collection Agency & Service, Inc.
Landers v. National Railroad Passenger Corp.
K Mart Corporation v. Cartier, Inc.
FERC v. Martin Exploration Management Company
United Paperworkers Int'l Union, AFL-CIO v. Misco, Inc.
Employment Division, Department of Human Resources of the State of Oregon v. Smith
question: Can a state deny unemployment benefits to a worker fired for using prohibited drugs for religious purposes?

name: Trans World Airlines, Inc. v. Flight Attendants
Coy v. Iowa
question: Does a defendant have the right to confront his alleged victims "face-to-face" under the Sixth Amendment if they testify against him before a jury?

name: Doe v. United States
question: Does a court’s order that a citizen who has not yet been indicted by a grand jury must authorize the release of undisclosed foreign bank documents violate the Fifth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that a court order to authorize the release of undisclosed foreign bank documents does not violate the Fifth Amendment rights of a citizen who has not yet been indicted by a grand jury.

name: National Labor Relations Board v. United Food & Commercial Workers Union, Local 23, AFL-CIO
Peralta v. Heights Medical Center, Inc.
Thompson v. Oklahoma
question: Would the execution of a 15 year old violate the Eighth Amendment's prohibition against "cruel and unusual punishments"?

name: Morrison v. Olson
question: Did the Act violate the constitutional principal of separation of powers?

name: United States Catholic Conference v. Abortion Rights Mobilization, Inc.
question: May a nonparty witness challenge a civil contempt citation by challenging the court’s subject matter jurisdiction over the underlying lawsuit?
description: A case in which the Court held that a nonparty witness may challenge the court’s jurisdiction over the underlying lawsuit in defense of a civil contempt citation.

name: Regents of the University of California v. Public Employment Relations Board
Lingle v. Norge Division of Magic Chef, Inc.
Riley v. National Federation of the Blind of North Carolina
D. H. Holmes Company, Ltd. v. McNamara
Arkansas Best Corporation v. Commissioner of Internal Revenue
Schweiker v. Chilicky
question: When a government employee violates a citizen’s legal rights, should that citizen be allowed to pursue monetary damages as compensation, even when the violated statute does not contain monetary damages as a possible remedy in its remedial process?
description: A case in which the Court held that when a government employee violates a citizen’s legal rights, that citizen is not allowed to pursue monetary damages as compensation when the violated statute does not contain monetary damages as a possible remedy.

name: Chick Kam Choo v. Exxon Corporation
California v. Greenwood
question: Did the warrantless search and seizure of Greenwood's garbage violate the Fourth Amendment's search and seizure guarantee?
description: A case in which the Court held that garbage placed on the sidewalk was not protected under the Fourth Amendment.

name: United States Department of Justice v. Julian
Bowen v. Kendrick
question: Do AFLA's provisions, requiring its beneficiaries to involve both religious and governmental organizations in addressing the problems of teenage sexual relations, violate the First Amendment's Establishment Clause?

name: New York State Club Association Inc. v. City of New York
question: Did the City of New York violate First Amendment rights to free association when applying anti-discrimination laws to social clubs that were not "distinctly private"?

name: Virginia v. American Booksellers Association, Inc.
City of Lakewood v. Plain Dealer Publishing Co.
question: Did Lakewood's city ordinance violate freedom of speech rights as protected by the First Amendment?

name: Immigration and Naturalization Service v. Abudu
Hustler Magazine, Inc. v. Falwell
question: Does the First Amendment's freedom of speech protection extend to the making of patently offensive statements about public figures, resulting perhaps in their suffering emotional distress?
description: A case in which the Court ruled that the First Amendment's freedom of speech protection extended to the making of clearly offensive statements about public figures, so long as such speech could not reasonably be construed to convey facts about its subject.

name: Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation v. Mayacamas Corporation
Puerto Rico Department of Consumer Affairs v. Isla Petroleum Corporation
United States v. Wells Fargo Bank
Department of the Navy v. Egan
Equal Employment Opportunity Commission v. Commercial Office Products Company
Michigan v. Chesternut
question: Does a police officer violate the Fourth Amendment’s protection against seizures when he pursues a citizen without an objective basis for suspecting him of criminal activity?
description: The Court held the test of whether a seizure is protected under the Fourth Amendment is dependent on whether a reasonable man would conclude the police restrained his liberty to leave.

name: Stewart Organization, Inc. v. Ricoh Corporation
Tulsa Professional Collection Services, Inc. v. Pope
Mississippi Power & Light Company v. Mississippi ex rel. Moore
Immigration and Naturalization Service v. Pangilinan
Basic Inc. v. Levinson
question:
(1) Did the statements in question meet the standard for materiality defined by Section 10(b) of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934?

(2) Did the district court use the proper standard to certify the class?

name: Mullins Coal Company, Inc. v. Director, Office of Workers' Compensation Programs, United States Department of Labor
Carpenter v. United States
question:
(1) Can the petitioners be found guilty of securities crimes against the Wall Street Journal even though the Wall Street Journal had no interest in the securities traded?

(2) Did the petitioners use mail and wire services as an essential part of their scheme to defraud the Wall Street Journal of its property?
description: A case in which the Court held that pre-release of a newspaper’s publication schedule qualifies as using mail and wire as an essential part of a scheme to defraud an entity of their property.

name: Gwaltney of Smithfield, Ltd. v. Chesapeake Bay Foundation, Inc.
Langley v. Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation
Watson v. Fort Worth Bank & Trust
Kadrmas v. Dickinson Public Schools
question:
1. Was Kadrmas’ petition for a writ of certiorari barred because she was contracting for bus service with Dickinson Public Schools while her appeal was pending?

2. Did the application of a busing fee by Dickinson Public Schools deprive Sarita Kadrmas of a minimum access to education?

3. Did the application of a busing fee by Dickinson Public Schools to students at some but not all districts deprive students of equal protection under the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: City of St. Louis v. Praprotnik
Boos v. Barry
question: Did the District of Columbia Code violate the First Amendment of the Constitution?

name: Liljeberg v. Health Services Acquisition Corporation
Allied Tube & Conduit Corporation v. Indian Head, Inc.
Shapero v. Kentucky Bar Association
question: Does a Kentucky Supreme Court rule prohibiting direct mail advertisements by attorneys to prospective clients, even when there is no false or misleading information, violate the First Amendment?

name: Frisby v. Schultz
question: Does a city ordinance prohibiting picketing in front of residential homes violate the First Amendment?

name: City of New York v. Federal Communications Commission
Arizona v. Roberson
question: Does the interrogation of a suspect after he has requested counsel regarding a separate investigation violate the defendant’s Fifth Amendment rights?
description: A case in which the Court held that once a suspect has requested counsel, police cannot interrogate him unless he initiates the contact.

name: Bendix Autolite Corporation v. Midwesco Enterprises, Inc.
Supreme Court of Virginia v. Friedman
question: Did the Virginia law violate the Privileges and Immunities Clause of the Constitution?

name: Christianson v. Colt Industries Operating Corporation
Mccoy v. Court Of Appeals Of Wisconsin
Clark v. Jeter
question: Did the Pennsylvania law violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Bank of Nova Scotia v. United States
Huddleston v. United States
question: Must a court make a preliminary ruling on whether the prosecution has proven that the defendant is guilty of “similar acts” by a preponderance of the evidence before submitting such character evidence to the jury?
description: A case in which the Court held that requiring the trial court to make a preliminary ruling before admitting character evidence is contrary to Article IV of the Federal Rules of Evidence.

name: New Energy Company of Indiana v. Limbach
question: Did the law discriminate against interstate commerce and violate the Commerce Clause?

name: South Carolina v. Baker
question: Did the TEFRA violate the Tenth Amendment and intergovernmental tax immunity?
